results.title: Pharmacodynamic profile of bisoprolol, a new beta 1-selective adrenoceptor antagonist.
results.text_hl: The dose-response relationship using individual maximal reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Exercise_Induced_Allergies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092202 @@@ET@@@ showed, on a molar basis, that @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ is about 5, 7 and 10 times more effective than @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@, respectively.

citations.NLM: Leopold G, Ungethüm W, Pabst J, Simane Z, Bühring KU, Wiemann H. Pharmacodynamic profile of bisoprolol, a new beta 1-selective adrenoceptor antagonist. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1986 Sep;22(3):293-300. PMID: 2876722
citations.BibTeX: @article{2876722, title={Pharmacodynamic profile of bisoprolol, a new beta 1-selective adrenoceptor antagonist.}, author={Leopold G and Ungethüm W and Pabst J and Simane Z and Bühring KU and Wiemann H}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={22}, number={3}, pages={293-300}}

results.title: Running performance as a function of the dose-response relationship to beta-adrenoceptor blockade.
results.text_hl: With 160 mg @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, a greater @<m>DISEASE_Exercise_Induced_Allergies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092202 @@@exercise impairment@@@ occurred than with 100 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (P less than 0.05).

citations.NLM: Kaiser P. Running performance as a function of the dose-response relationship to beta-adrenoceptor blockade. Int J Sports Med. 1982 Feb;3(1):29-32. PMID: 6121762
citations.BibTeX: @article{6121762, title={Running performance as a function of the dose-response relationship to beta-adrenoceptor blockade.}, author={Kaiser P}, journal={Int J Sports Med}, volume={3}, number={1}, pages={29-32}}

results.title: Acute effect of indenolol on human airways.
results.text_hl: The relative potency against @<m>DISEASE_Exercise_Induced_Allergies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092202 @@@exercise-tachicardia@@@ was @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ greater than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ greater than @CHEMICAL_indenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:C002989 @@@indenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Zanon P, Bruschi C, Cerveri I, Rossi A, Karitinos P, Pamparana F. Acute effect of indenolol on human airways. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1985;29(3):287-92. PMID: 2866966
citations.BibTeX: @article{2866966, title={Acute effect of indenolol on human airways.}, author={Zanon P and Bruschi C and Cerveri I and Rossi A and Karitinos P and Pamparana F}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={29}, number={3}, pages={287-92}}
